adqlParser.query
Class ADQLOrder

java.lang.Object
  adqlParser.query.ColumnReference
      adqlParser.query.ADQLOrder
All Implemented Interfaces:
ADQLObject
public class ADQLOrder
extends ColumnReference

Represents an item of the ORDER BY list: that's to say a column reference plus a sorting indication (ASC, DESC).

Version:
06/2010
Author:
Grégory Mantelet (CDS)
See Also:
ColumnReference

Field Detail

descSorting

protected boolean descSorting
Gives an indication about how to order the results of a query. (true for DESCending, false for ASCending)

Constructor Detail

ADQLOrder

public ADQLOrder(int colIndice)
          throws ParseException
Creates an order indication with the index of the selected column on which an ASCending ordering will be done.

Parameters:
colIndice - The index of a selected column (from 1).
Throws:
ParseException - If the index is less or equal 0.
See Also:
ADQLOrder(int, boolean)

ADQLOrder

public ADQLOrder(int colIndice,
                 boolean desc)
          throws ParseException
Creates an order indication with the index of the selected column on which the specified ordering will be done.

Parameters:
colIndice - The index of a selected column (from 1).
desc - true means DESCending order, false means ASCending order.
Throws:
ParseException - If the index is less or equal 0.

ADQLOrder

public ADQLOrder(java.lang.String colName)
          throws ParseException
Creates an order indication with the name or the alias of the selected column on which an ASCending ordering will be done.

Parameters:
colName - The name or the alias of a selected column.
Throws:
ParseException - If the given name is null or is an empty string.
See Also:
ADQLOrder(String, boolean)

Parameters:
colName - The name of the alias of a selected column.
desc - true means DESCending order, false means ASCending order.
Throws:
ParseException - If the given name is null or is an empty string.
Method Detail

isDescSorting

public boolean isDescSorting()
Gives the way the results will be sorted.

Returns:
true DESCending order, false ASCending order.
